title: Johnny Depp Says He Drank Wine From Paper Cups With Alleged Assault Victim After Incident, Even Took Selfies
text:
Johnny Depp says his interaction with a location manager, who had sued him for punching him on set of a movie, ended nicely with a toast of wine, hugs, and even a selfie.

According to legal documents obtained by The Blast, for the first time, we are getting to hear the story from Depp in his own words.

The 'Pirates of the Carribean' star sat down for a deposition in the case and answered questions about the altercation. Brook's attorney questioned the actor for several hours about what exactly transpired.

Rocky Brooks sued Depp claiming the actor punched him after arguing over filming hours, and location. Johnny responded to the lawsuit by claiming Brooks was being disrespectful to a homeless woman on the set, and he simply intervened.

"I witnessed Mr. Brooks behaving in an irrational and sort of angry manner in which he began too -- there happened to be an elderly woman who I supposed he felt was in his way -- I don't know. But he -- he was very disrespectful to her and use harsh words with her as if she had done something to him," the actor began.

Depp continued, "He had -- his words to her were with great anger and bitterness -- and you know, there was a lot of poison in it. And it was -- it was not just, and it was belligerent. And my reaction to that was to stop that confrontation. Was to remind him that he was on a film set and this -- he had no right to speak to that woman in that way he was speaking to her. Had no right to treat her that way. Did he think that he was more important than she was?"
